comments.body: Seeing as adult squids would likely be "too big" to fit in buckets, perhaps they could make it so baby squids can be put in buckets instead.
You shouldn't just hear dripping, you should see dripping
How is adding dripstone block variations "other than decoration"?

I like the idea but why not stuff like a tool made from dripstone.

One use could be a secondary way to make glass.

Turn quartz to iron by putting the two in a crafting table.

The inability to be blown up.
The block is everything but decorative because it looks like crap right now. So varients would make sense.
it would be used for more functionality
Would make more sense to use copper as a wire to attach between the 2 points.
Gotta agree with you. This would make cliffs more fun to descend down from
You know that villagers only like emeralds?
Like opal, topaz, citrine, garnet, onyx, sapphire, and pearls (from clams). Villagers wouldn't have to trade with those, though.

This is a great idea! More variety, PLEASE.

(P.S. You should do more than this one post!)
It would be great if it was like the old quiver idea.
This would be a good feature that combines the caves and cliff aspects of the update.
I think it'd be pretty cool if the frozen stone was actually slippery, that way we could use slippery slabs and stairs in parkour courses.

Maybe it should act like redstone dust, but is unable to connect with it and has a shorter range to compensate for its ability to go up walls? something like a ten block max distance instead of fifteen
It could also act as a new type of Underwater Redstone

Exactly what I was thinking, this is definitely a Minecraft-y approach to vertical redstone and will be a great use to copper. Being able to use coppered redstone next to regular redstone without connecting can also make for more compact redstone contraptions. 

I agree with one of the other comments, there needs to be a drawback to make redstone distinct and not obsolete. It may be counter intuitive to real life, but if the copper redstone had a slight tick delay on useage, like a repeater for example, this can make the regular dust more useful for quick actions and coppered redstone more useful for compact redstone.
I think bundles could be set on the ground with shift + set command so you could use it with a chest ui
It'd be cool if they were in the deep dark just to have a little more of a reason to go down there
That would be perfect! This would add so much life to the underground. Maybe their village could be a mix of houses and caves...
Perhaps there should additionally be "local lava level" in the nether, so you don't have to fall as far to die in lav... I mean, find Striders.
I believe that the height you enter the Nether with should be the same as the Overworld, so unless you enter the Nether on top of a mountain, you'll be pretty close to ground level.
AND, we could implement the vertical biome code that the caves will use maybe? But maybe the nether would need more biome variety first for that to make sense
Since the limit height increased beyond 156, a Nether from layer 0 to 256 would still not angry the players who still desire to make their traditional farms above the nether ceiling
The height of the Nether from "floor" to "ceiling" is 128 blocks, with a technical limit of 256. Obviously it's worth increasing the height to the logical 256th level.
I agree. If we want dim lighting we could just use less candles.

One candle should also be brighter and they should also not emit smoke.... and the flame should not flicker out of existence... and the flame particle should not be effected by light (like spider eyes)

Dim yeah but maybe one light level more?
They should at most flicker like how torches do, keep a flame that is stationary, and put the particle effect over that so it looks like it's flickering but has a constant flame
This but it should change the wick texture into an animated lit form with those particles.

They're those trick birthday candles. Sigh.

Yes, I agree. I'm ok with them having some flickering and variability, like the environment is a bit drafty, but going out entirely takes away from the esthetic that makes me want to use them in the first place.
Lol We've just started using candles for the first time in our new world and I've just spent the last 10 minutes trying to find a jira report for this. Weird design choice I guess?
Yes. Please fix this - it is a very annoying immersion breaking issue. The candles are a great idea - but they go out randomly. Thanks.
It should be an iron door though. A wooden door would just be weird.
or they could just make the iron door tinted

That should mean we should craft Glass Doors first with a recipe of Glass panes in the middle and iron ingots sandwiching it. Then from that, you surround it with amethyst shards to make a tinted glass door.
the warden was made to be sneaked around and to be tricked, not to be fought head on so no this idea is kinda bad sorry
I think making the Warden have to slow down to use the Sonic Shriek would be the best change, it just makes more sense.

First comment! 
Lime green axolotls were removed, but nobody’s quite sure why. Mojang said they had to remove them, but they haven’t released why. Please tell us!

I was really hoping they would bring it back with the addition of lush caves. Maybe they can make the brown ones appear more with the new mud blocks next update. More biome related variants would be cool.
This would look realy cool. Though, it probaly would be hard to do.
It looks cool, but lore wise I’m not sure how it’ll work

I've seen a lot of fun feedback ideas for copper, and I agree that it's uses should be more to the creative/inventive edge verse just another tool/weapon/armor set. Some I've really liked so far:

Bellows: increase smelting speed, manual (button) like action at first cut could be automated with redstone later

Redstone Fans: (much like a lot trap mods)

Copper glinting: Add damage to arrows/bows/crossbows

Pipes (really common idea)/cheaper hopper (slower and uses a barrel)

Wires: redstone signal transmission (vertical, horizontal, and water loggable) best idea had it so you had to use a solid copper block to interact with redstone components ex. [Redstone block/Power] [Cu Blk}{Wire}---------------{Wire}{Cu Blk][comparator][Piston] adds a little complexity but also more use of copper. 

Farm automation/Lumber automation/Block breaking automation: I always love Quality of Life ideas that reduce grind, shame there are not more vanilla options even if automation costs some sort of fuel to balance it the more a base runs itself the more you can go adventure.
It needs to be like a tool to use for gears and armor in between stone and iron.
I really like the idea of copper pipes. I think that would definitely be one way to make copper much more useful.
I have seen this done on Java by Phil, but everytime I try to do it with mine on bedrock it doesn't work. Probably a parity issue. I wish it was on both versions.
И ещё плиты, забор, резные кирпичи, ступени будут в тему

yes, i agree, that would be great!

(i translated it, it was about slabs and stairs and stuff)
This actually would be a nice addition!
It would add more reasons to go to look for a dripstone cave
That's a great idea! I think a zoom enchant could be used and like zoom I would zoom in 20% more up to zoom V could zoom 2x more

There have been one or two other suggestions for spyglass enchantments. One I've seen was an enchantment to make invisible players visible again. There could also be spyglasses with more zoom enchantment, I agree. Maybe an enchantment that allows the player to see night vision through it!
Sandstone in deserts, Red Sandstone in badlands, perhaps.
I love this idea.

#MeToo

 

The dungeons should also be bigger, so it would be more dramatic and intense to be in them :D.

 

Maybe a new block in the cold biomes. Frosty stone? Just like mossy cobblestone but lightblue replaces the dark green color.
damn this kinda got added

This would be nice for offsetting the usage of (Zombified) Piglin farms and also give players the option to mine large veins of Nether gold to encourage mining in the Nether instead of sitting at a farm.
They even introduced the large Iron ore veins to provide a alternative to getting more iron from actually mining instead of sitting at Iron golem farms to compete and give us more options to get iron efficiently.
Well, there's an issue that arises from this though. Calcite is currently not renewable. There would need to be a way to renew Calcite. Perhaps something like crafting Amethyst with Diorite?
what about calcite slabs and stairs in these variants?
yes plis i have wanted this since it was added
